meanings.definition: Qurushes (noun): a unit of currency in Saudi Arabia
meanings.sent1: I need to save up enough qurushes to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent2: In Saudi Arabia, people use qurushes to buy groceries.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped all my qurushes in the mud!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes lit up when she saw the pile of shiny qurushes.
meanings.sent5: The sound of jingling qurushes filled the market.

meanings.definition: Qurushes (verb): to exchange or convert money into a different currency
meanings.sent1: I will qurushes my dollars into euros before my trip.
meanings.sent2: He needed to qurushes his yen into dollars at the airport.
meanings.sent3: She decided to qurushes her allowance into coins for the arcade.
meanings.sent4: The traveler had to qurushes his rupees into pounds at the bank.
meanings.sent5: The cashier helped me qurushes my pesos into dollars.

meanings.definition: Qurushes (adjective): relating to or denominated in the currency of Saudi Arabia
meanings.sent1: The shop only accepted qurushes currency.
meanings.sent2: She collected coins from different countries, including qurushes ones.
meanings.sent3: His qurushes wallet matched his traditional attire perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The souvenir shop sold unique items with qurushes designs.
meanings.sent5: The bank teller handed me a stack of qurushes bills.
